fields.value: Chance-Corrected Measures of Foreign Policy Similarity (FPSIM Version 2)

authorAffiliation.value: Department of Politics and Public Administration, University of Limerick

datasetContactAffiliation.value: Department of Politics and Public Administration, University of Limerick

dsDescriptionValue.value: The FPSIM dataset provides measures of foreign policy similarity of dyads based on alliance ties (Correlates of War, version 4.1) and UN General Assembly voting (Voeten, version 17) for all members of the international system (Correlates of War system membership list, version 5.0). The alliance data cover the time period from 1816 to 2012, and the UN voting data from 1946 to 2015. The similarity measures include various versions of Ritter and Signorino's S (weighted/non-weighted by material capabilities; squared/absolute distance metrics) as well as the chance-corrected measures Cohen's Kappa and Scott's Pi. The measures based on alliance data come in two versions: one is based on valued alliance ties and the other is based on binary alliance ties.

keywordValue.value: International Relations, Foreign Policy, Similarity, Affinity, Chance-Correction

publicationCitation.value:
When using these data, please cite the version number and the following journal article:</BR>
Häge, Frank M. (2011): Choice or Circumstance? Adjusting Measures of Foreign Policy Similarity for Chance Agreement. Political Analysis 19, 3: 287-305.</BR>
</BR>
Citation for UN General Assembly voting data:</BR>
Voeten, Erik (2013): Data and Analyses of Voting in the United States General Assembly. P. 41-53 in Bob Reinalda (ed.): Routledge Handbook of International Organization (London: Routledge).</BR>
</BR>
Citation for Correlates of War alliance data:</BR>
Gibler, Douglas M. (2009): International military alliances, 1648-2008. CQ Press.</BR>
</BR>
Citation for Cohen's Kappa:</BR>
Cohen, Jacob (1960): A Coefficient of Agreement for Nominal Scales. Educational and Psychological Measurement 20:37–46.</BR>
</BR>
Citation for Scott's Pi:</BR>
Scott, William A. (1955): Reliability of Content Analysis: The Case of Nominal Scale Coding. The Public Opinion Quarterly 19(3): 321–5.</BR>
</BR>
Citation for Ritter and Signorino's S:</BR>
Signorino, Curtis S., and Jeffrey M. Ritter (1999): Tau-b or not Tau-b: Measuring the Similarity of Foreign Policy Positions. International Studies Quarterly 43:115–44.

files.description: Complete replication archive with Stata do-files for the creation of the FPSIM dataset of similarity measures from raw UNGA voting, COW alliance, COW material capabilities, and COW system membership data.
